page.title: 11The Village School,Cressage
page.content: {Christchurch Church of England {School}is on the Sheinton Road. There are 4{classrooms}and a{hall}in the main school, and there is a separate{wooden classroom. }The school has large{playing fields,}a{playground and a{conservation area. There are 5 full-time teachers, including the head, and one part-time teacher. Children start school when they are nearly 5. Many children live outside{Cressage;}most of these travel on the school minibus. In school, we learn how to read and write, we sketch and paint and model, do Maths, sing, play music, do Physical Education and Games, and study things around us. {Midday meals}are cooked in the school {kitchen}but some children bring sandwiches. After their 11th birthday, most children transfer to the{Much {Wenlock comprehensive school.
